channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'We need to get out of here': Trump's immigration crackdown is quietly reshaping where immigrants live in America
item.description: The Trump administration says that more than 1.6 million immigrants have self-deported. But there's also evidence of an internal migration from target...

item.title: What new Epstein emails say. And, ACA subsidies in limbo
item.description: Details on the newly released emails from Jeffrey Epstein. And, the government shutdown has ended, but health insurance subsidies remain in limbo, wit...

item.title: The government shutdown is over, but not everything is back to normal
item.description: President Trump signed a bill reopening the government Wednesday night, but it will take more than a day for some things to return to business as usua...

item.title: If you're going to be kind to another human, today is the day to do it!
item.description: November 13 is World Kindness Day. Its goal is to encourage acts of kindness. (After all, one kind day is better than none.) Here's a look at the natu...

item.title: Why home insurance is unaffordable, even in places without wildfires or hurricanes
item.description: Some of the country's highest home insurance prices are in the central U.S., a region generally considered to be protected from climate-driven disaste...

item.title: Shocking report alleges Venezuelan migrants deported to El Salvador faced potential torture
item.description: A recent watchdog report alleges that the Venezuelan migrants who were deported to El Salvador's CECOT mega prison were subjected to "constant beating...

item.title: Nigeria cancels mother-tongue teaching in primary schools and reverts to English
item.description: Exam results from areas which dropped English have declined, the education minister says, announcing the U-turn.

item.title: Starbucks workers launch strike, demanding labor contract
item.description: Starbucks Workers United is calling the strike the "red cup rebellion," since it coincides with the coffee chain's annual Red Cup Day promotion.

item.title: SNAP benefits to resume quickly after shutdown ends, experts say
item.description: A government funding package signed by President Trump on Wednesday will reopen federal agencies, opening the door for food-stamp recipients to collec...

item.title: Anthony Zurcher: Democrats left bruised after historic shutdown yields little
item.description: Trump emerges from the shutdown having made little in the way of substantive concessions to Democrats in Congress.

item.title: Government begins to reopen after Trump signs bill ending shutdown
item.description: The government is starting to reopen after President Trump signed a bill to fund the government through Jan. 30. Follow live updates here.

item.title: What we know about new Epstein emails that mention Trump
item.description: In emails released by Democrats, Epstein says Trump "knew about the girls". The White House says they are an attempt to "smear" the president.

item.title: US calls for international action to cut weapons supply to Sudan paramilitaries
item.description: "They're committing acts of sexual violence and atrocities," says the US secretary of state, "and it needs to end immediately".

item.title: Epstein email says Andrew had photo taken with Virginia Giuffre
item.description: The message sent by Epstein reads: "Yes she [Giuffre] was on my plane and yes she had her picture taken with Andrew"

item.title: Analyzing the Trump references in the latest Epstein emails released
item.description: New emails released by Democrats in the House Oversight Committee appear to depict how Jeffrey Epstein referred to Trump in private conversations. CBS...

item.title: FAA says flight cuts will stay at 6% because more air traffic controllers are coming to work
Judge signals hundreds of people detained in Chicago immigration crackdown could be released on bond
The timeline for SNAP benefits remains uncertain, even as the government is set to reopen
item.description: President Donald Trump has signed a measure to reopen the government and resume full food aid benefits that were paused at the start of November.
